item.title: Final Fantasy+, Trials of Mana+ and More Coming to Apple Arcade This Month
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/final-fantasy-trials-of-mana-and-more-coming-to-apple-arcade-this-month/

With 2025 kicking off, Apple Arcade is introducing 10 new games to its subscription service, including titles like Final Fantasy+ and Trials of Mana+ from Square Enix. 

Apple Arcade has introduced seven new games for players to try out today, including Square Enix’s Final Fantasy+ and Trials of Mana+. Final Fantasy+ is an award-winning title from the App Store that takes players through a remastered 2D version of the original title. Trials of Mana+, on the other hand, is a mobile port of the popular action RPG’s console version. 

Other games include Skate City: New York, a new addition to the Skate City series where you master new tricks while exploring the streets of New York. Gears and Goo is a new game for the Apple Vision Pro, which blends aspects of tower defense and classic base-building games with interactive possibilities of spatial computing. Three Kingdom Heroes has also joined Apple Arcade’s roster as the latest game in Koei Tecmo’s hit series. 

Apple Arcade has also introduced Rodeo Stampede+, and It’s Literally Just Mowing+ today. Regarding the other three games, Apple Arcade’s first officially licensed PGA TOUR game, PGA Tour Pro Golf, will join the service on February 6, 2025. Along with it, we will see the likes of Doodle Jump 2+ and My Dear Farm+ join the fray too. 

In other news, Prime Gaming is giving away 16 games in January. Also, recently, claims about Sony and Apple partnering up for Vision Pro controllers surfaced online. What are your thoughts on this month’s Apple Arcade games? Let us know in the comments below or on our community forum!
